citeinfo.title: National Oil and Gas Assessment Province Boundaries through 2012

descript.abstract: The USGS Central Region Energy Team assesses oil and gas resources of the United States. The onshore and State water areas of the United States comprise 71 provinces. Within these provinces, Total Petroleum Systems are defined and Assessment Units are defined and assessed. Each of province is defined geologically, and most province boundaries are defined by major geologic changes. This dataset is a compilation of data that has been studied and published separately, and in some cases adjacent provinces do not share a common boundary. As a consequence, there are numerous gaps and overlaps in this layer.
descript.purpose: This dataset illustrate the geologic boundaries of provinces as defined for National Oil and Gas Resource Assessment Project from 1995 throug 2012.

idinfo.useconst: Several of the re-assessed provinces in the rocky mountain area are significantly modified from the 1995 boundary, some of these create overlaps and gaps with neighboring provinces. Users are advised to bear this in mind when using this dataset for analytical purposes.

srcinfo.srccontr: The Piedmont, Blue Ridge Thrust Belt, Atlantic Coastal Plain, and New England Provinces Boundary replaced the 1995 assessment boundary. It was built as a merge of four 1995-assesment provinces (5068, 5069, 5070, 5072).

procstep.procdesc: 1995 Oil and Gas Assessment Province data was copied. Coded all provinces that were assessed into the 'STATUS' column.

As new provinces were assessed, updated geometry and attributes were appended to the dataset and previous province geometry was removed. No effort was made to 'match' overlaps and gaps between provinces. The 'SOURCE' column was populated with of the data source for the geometry. If the geometry was unchanged, '1995 Assessment Boundary' is indicated. If the geometry was modified, it was noted in the SOURCE column. In two cases, recent assessments merged more than one 1995 province, which is also noted in the SOURCE column.

dataqual.logic: As new provinces were assessed, updated geometry and attributes were appended to the dataset. No effort was made to 'match' overlaps and gaps between provinces. Added in the 'SOURCE' column annotation of the data source for the geometry. If the geometry was unchanged, '1995 Assessment Boundary' is indicated. If the geometry was modified, it was noted in the SOURCE column . In two cases, recent assessments merged more than one 1995 province, which is also noted in the SOURCE column.

enttyp.enttypl: U.S. Geological Survey US Oil and Gas Assessment Province Boundaries
enttyp.enttypds: U.S. Geological Survey Central Energy Resource Science Center

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: Province code, a 4 character value enumerating Oil and Gas Assessment provinces.
attr.attrdefs: U.S. Geological Survey Energy Resource Provinces
U.S. Geological Survey Energy Resource Provinces

attr.attrdef: The latest assessment status of the province. If the province has had one or more oil and gas assessment, it is labeled 'Assessed', if it has not, then it is labeled 'Not quantitatively assessed'.

This represents the approximate date of the latest assessment information for each province. In some cases, this is accurate to the day that a publication describing the assessment is released, in others it may only be accurate to the year, in which case January 1 is used. It is recommended that users only rely on the year portion of this date for future analysis.

This field describes the source of the province geometry. The original source for all provinces was the 1995 National Oil and Gas assessment. Many provinces have been assessed after this process, and some of the assessment geologists have modified the province boundary. If the geometry was modified this field will indicate the assessment year that it was released. In two cases, the geometry source reflects where multiple 1995 province boundaries were merged into a single province.
Length of feature in internal units.

attrdomv.udom: Positive real numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: Area of feature in internal units squared.

attrdomv.udom: Positive real numbers that are automatically generated.

overview.eaover: A 4-digit province code (PROVCODE) is assigned to each province, for the United States, provinces start at 5001 and increment to 5071, with a handful of gaps. [PROVNAME] indicates the name of the province. [STATUS] describes if the province has been assessed by the USGS for undiscovered oil and gas resources. [LASTUPD] indicated the year, and, at times, day and month, of the latest assessment of the province. [SOURCE] describes the source of the geometry of the province. In some cases, the province boundary was updated from assessments after 1995.

distinfo.distliab: Although the data has been processed on the computer system at the U.S. Geological Survey, U.S. Department of the Interior, no warranty, expressed or implied, is made by the Geological Survey regarding the utility of the data on any other system, nor shall the act of distribution constitute any such warranty.
